articles.title: Ridiculous act of hound  = KCNA commentary =
articles.content:
Ridiculous act of hound  = KCNA commentary = 
 Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- Mark Twain, a famous writer of the United States, said in an article contributed to a newspaper that some of the U.S. congressmen were fools. 
   Protested by angry law-makers, however, he said again that some of them were not fools.
   His remark is now proved by a former member of the House of Representatives of the United States.
   He reportedly said he would have a good "understanding" of the DPRK's "human rights situation" through those who defected to South Korea and write a "feature article" about it.
   Admittedly, defectors and renegades are human dregs who forfeited their political integrity, human dignity.
   Most of them have been reduced to marionettes and slaves by the South Korean "Agency for National Security Planning."
   It is really ridiculous for a person who was once active as a congressman in the united states to distort the DPRK's situation of human rights and hurt its image with the help of human dregs, bribed by colonial puppets.
   If he dare write a "feature article" reflecting the offscourings' abuses, it will only draw world public cynicism.
   If he really wants to win a fame as "champion of human rights," he should clearly know of the U.S. Human rights record first of all. And he had better go to U.S. military camp side towns in South Korea and see how the "model of human rights" has been displayed by GIs in brothels.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il sends wreath to bier of late C1u Sok Bong
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il sends wreath to bier of late C1u Sok Bong
 Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent a wreath to the bier of the late Chu Sok Bong, people's artiste of the April 25 Film Studio of the Korean People's Army, on July 17 to express deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Row about "threat of invasion of south"
articles.content:
Row about "threat of invasion of south"
 Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- The South Korean authorities held a "meeting  of heads of those organs related to combined defence" on July 16, and set "a period of specially intensified posture against local provocations" from July to September, according to a radio report from Seoul.
   They said that during the period they will examine the residents' report network and  strengthen coastal guard to cope with the "threat of invasion of the south," and will periodically stage trainings of providing against the crisis, which involve army, police and the "Agency for National Security Planning."
   This is a provocative move to pour cold water on the South Korean people's desire for reunification ever mounting with the approach of the grand pro-reunification festival to be held at Panmunjom on August 15 and to interfere with the festival.

articles.title: Ministry of National Unification, variant of "Agency for National Security Planning"
articles.content:
Ministry of National Unification, variant of "Agency for National Security Planning"
  Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today describes the South Korean puppet Ministry of National Unification as a variant of the "Agency for National Security Planning."
   The daily cites concrete facts, saying that the "Agency for National Security Planning" and the "Ministry of National Unification" are a  carriage and pair running against national reunification which are identical to each other in purpose and mission, as well as in techniques employed for an anti-north, anti-reunification campaign of confrontation.
   Just as the "Agency for National Security Planning" is, the puppet Ministry of National Unification is the anti-reunification headquarters which drafts, makes out and puts into effect a "unification policy" of the separatist government authorities, the daily says, and continues:
   The minister, vice-ministers and section chiefs of the puppet Ministry of National Unification are of "ANSP" origin or have personal ties with it.
   Nearly all of the 38 officials who were driven out of the "ANSP" on March 24 hold important posts of the "Ministry of National Unification."
   The puppet Ministry of National Unification sets itself against the removal of  the fascist "National Security Law" and "Agency for National Security Planning" against the nation and reunification. Worse still, it says that it will push ahead with inter-Korean dialogue, which is the internal affair of the nation, through "sincere discussions with outsiders," including the United States and Japan, and that the military presence of the U.S. should continue in the south of Korea even after the reunification of Korea.

articles.title: LWR project is not U.S. present to DPRK  = KCNA commentary =
articles.content:
LWR project is not U.S. present to DPRK  = KCNA commentary =
Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- The Light Water Reactor (LWR) project funder the DPRK-U.S. framework agreement has still been at a standstill.
   To our disappointment, there has been  another ominous rumour regarding the project.
   Recently, the Japanese Mainichi Shimbun quoted KEDO (Korean Peninsula Energy Development Organization) sources as saying the construction of two LWRs may be completed after 2007, not by 2003 that is the agreed year.
   The rumour implies that the prospect of the project is indefinite and it may peter out without result.
   How the United States implements the agreement is enough to clearly show whether its promise is true or not.
   The rumor came when nearly four years had passed since the adoption of the agreement but the United States has failed to settle even the cost sharing in KEDO, start the construction and supply heavy oil as scheduled.
   The fact indicates that the United States has apparently taken an insincere attitude towards the agreement.
   The LWR project is not a present the united states gives to the DPRK. It is what United States promised and what it is obliged to do.
   The United States should know that if it fails to keep its promise, we will take another choice.
   Our final decision depends on the U.S. future attitude.
   If the agreement is left without any real meaning and the project is delayed, we cannot but reconsider the building of our own nuclear power industry.
   If then, the responsibility for all the consequencies will rest with the United States.

articles.title: Achievements in Korea
articles.content:
Achievements in Korea
 Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- The Korean working people aqe making remarkable achievements in production and construction with the approach of the election of deputies to the Supreme People's Assembly.
   According to data available at the Ministry of Metal Industry, steel production increased nearly  three times, pig iron production twice and the production of rolled steel more than twice in the last two months as against the earlier two months.
   The Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex produced several thousand more tons of steel and rolled steel in the last one month than in the previous month.
   The daily average steel output at the Songjin Steel Complex in July is 30 percent higher than in the similar period of the previous month.
   The electricity additionally turned out by power stations across the country in the last month is hundreds of millions of kwh.
   In this period, scores of minor power stations have been built.
   Coal mines under the Anju, Kaechon and South Hamgyong provincial area coal complexes increased the speed of tunnelling to secure more reserve cutting faces. They are daily producing coal 20 percent more than that in the corresponding days of the previous month.
   Successes were also reported from the railway transport domain.
   These days the transport of coal, iron ore and timber at the Kaechon Railway Bureau is up 26, 15 and 27 percent respectively over the figures recorded in the similar period of the previous month.
   Constructors of railways between Haeju and Ongjin and between Singangryong and Pupho are increasing the speed of construction nearly twice.
   Remarkable achievements are also being made in the construction of the capital including the project of a new street between Rimhung rotary and Sinmi-dong, the April 25 Film Studio and the April 25 Hotel.
   Particularly, the constructors of the April 25 Hotel completed the plastering of the interior and exterior of the major and auxiliary buildings in a short period. They are now pushing ahead with the exterior facilities project and the arrangement of the zone at the final stage.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denounces U.S. policy of military bloc
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denounces U.S. policy of military bloc
 Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today denounces the dominative strategy of the United States in intensifying the military bloc, talking about a new "value of its existence" under the signboard of "peace keeping" and "security."
   The United States is working out its military strategy through military blocs with NATO  as the axis in Europe and with the United States,  Japan and South Korea  as the axis in the Asia-Pacific region, the daily says in a signed article, and goes on:
   It regards Europe and Asia as the main fronts in executing its world strategy.
   By expanding and intensifying the NATO, it is seeking to raise the value of its existence in Europe and, furthermore, strengthen its domination and control over Europe.
   It is going to form a new military bloc in Asia to take control of it to suit a new Asia-Pacific age. It is  attempting to build a new Asian military bloc with  satellite states with the United States, Japan and South Korea as  its axis and use it as a leverage to dominate Asia.
   Military bloc is a tool of aggression and intervention.
   By the assertion that military bloc is necessary for "keeping peace at present the U.S. means that it will seek open military intervention  in other countries' affairs on that pretext.
   The intention of the united states to strengthen aggressive military blocs and attain its wild ambition for world supremacy by relying on them  is as  foolish as trying to turn the world  back to the cold war era. This will only precipitate its ruin.

articles.title: Books published in China
articles.content:
Books published in China
 Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- The Harbin Publishing House of China brought out a book "Feelings of Friendship" written by those related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, and a book "Ju Chao San Ji" by Wang Hongbin, president of the old cadre creating committee of the Heilongjiang provincial writer association, and Wang Suyuan, president of the Heilongjaing provincial family planning association, who visited the DPRK last year.
   Carried in "Feelings of Friendship" are articles of former governor of Heilongjiang Province Chen Lei and his wife Li Min, former commander of the 2nd directional army of the 3rd corps of the anti-Japanese Allied Army (AJAA) Meng Qingqing, former commander of the 4th corps of the Ajaa Zhao Ruihua and former commander of the Ping Nanyang unit of the 5th corps of the Ajaa Song Wancai.
   Wang Hongbin wrote in the preface that the book would help the Chinese people have better knowledge of the exploits performed by Chinese and Korean communists and patriots in the bloody resistanc in northeast China and of personalities, reputation and kindness of Presudent Kim Il Sung, a national hero and prominent commander.
   "Lu Chao San Ji" introduces in detail the appearance of Pyongyang which has been built into a model of the 21st century's cities under the wise guidance of the great President Kim Il Sung and General Kim Jong Il as w3ll as the happy life of the Korean people and their spiritual and moral traits.

articles.title: Battle on Height 351
articles.content:
Battle on Height 351
 Pyongyang, July 18 (KCNA) -- Height 351 situated in the eastern part  of Kangwon Province, Korea, was one of points of tactical importance.
   The U.S. occupied the height in 1951 and  built a solid stronghold in a bid to join those units landing on the east coast and break through a flank of the front to come into the depth of our army.
   They  constructed two circular trenches and more than 20 pillboxes and excavated even a secret pit adjoining to an unnamed height in the south. And they put iron netting on entrances to shelters, pillboxes and pit to shut out handgrenades. A mine field was formed 25-30 metres from the trenches and wire entanglements were put  threefold at 3-5 metre intervals within and without. They called it an "impregnable fortress."
   Units of our army started an attack on the height with volleys of artillery pieces on June 2, Juche 42 (1953). The "fortress" built by the enemy for over two years was captured only in fifteen minutes.
   The enemy persistently attacked to retake the height with the support of flying corps, ground artillery pieces, guns of warships, etc. Everything was burnt and  not a rock remained intact.
  When soldiers of the people's army ran out of ammunition in the fierce battle, they fought hand-to-hand fight. 
   Wounded soldiers ran into the enemy with handgrenades between their teeth.
   They frustrated dozens of tenacious attacks of the enemy a day  by displaying mass heroism and self-sacrifice and defended the height of the country to the end.
   22 heroes of the republic including Kim In Thaek and Kim Ryong Thaek were produced in the battles to recapture and defend the height.
